sentences.en: Connally sought to cow opposition while Nixon's strategy was to outmaneuver it.
sentences.cn: 康纳利极力想把对方吓倒,而尼克松的方针是以谋略制胜.

sentences.en: Informal To top or outmaneuver ( a competitor ) in acquiring and publishing an important news story.
sentences.cn: 抢在 ( 对手 ) 之前获得和发布重要新闻消息.

sentences.en: My new supervisor knows how to outmaneuver the boss in most situations.
sentences.cn: 我的新上司在多数情况下都能够玩转老板.

sentences.en: They outnumber the high elves and can outmaneuver most enemies.
sentences.cn: 他们的数量比高等精灵多,而且可以以策略制胜多数敌人.

trans.tran_cn: 以策略制胜，以机动性胜过
